de.mdelab.simulator

Interface Scenario


  • public interface Scenario
    A scenario defines the simulation in terms of the injection of issues in each simulation round. That is, the simulator consults the scenario in each simulation round (i.e., each run of the feedback loop) to obtain the Injections to be performed in this round.
    Version:
    0.41
    Author:
    thomas vogel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Injection<? extends ArchitecturalElement>> getInjections(int currentRound)
      For each simulation round (i.e., one run of the feedback loop), the simulator consults the scenario to obtain the injections to be performed in this round by using this method.
      void notifyAboutSuccess(java.util.List<Injection<? extends ArchitecturalElement>> injections)
      The simulator notifies the scenario immediately after one simulation round about the success of the injections using this callback method.

    • Method Detail

      • getInjections

        java.util.List<Injection<? extends ArchitecturalElement>> getInjections(int currentRound)
        For each simulation round (i.e., one run of the feedback loop), the simulator consults the scenario to obtain the injections to be performed in this round by using this method.
        Parameters:
        currentRound - the number of the current simulation round.
        Returns:
        the list of injections to be performed by the simulator.

      • notifyAboutSuccess

        void notifyAboutSuccess(java.util.List<Injection<? extends ArchitecturalElement>> injections)
        The simulator notifies the scenario immediately after one simulation round about the success of the injections using this callback method. This information can be used as feedback to adjust the scenario in the subsequent simulation rounds. The methods must not necessarily be implemented.
        Parameters:
        injections - the list of injections defined by this scenario and whose individual success attributes have been set (see Injection.isSuccess()) by the simulator.
